dcterms:description: A dimmed triangular signal generated by the equation s(t) = A e^(-µt) g(P, t), where g(P, t) is a triangular signal of period P. The input series is directly obtained from this equation, while the reference output series is the same series several steps forward in time.
dcterms:title: Dimmed Triangular Signal

dcterms:description: A forced Van der Pol signal described by a differential equation with a sinusoidal perturbation. The input series is generated from the equation ds²/dt² - µ(1 - s²) ds/dt + s = A sin(ωt), while the label is a shifted version of the input series.
dcterms:title: Non-linear Damping Signal with Sinusoidal Perturbation

dcterms:description: A dataset consisting of two Van der Pol signals without perturbation, each described by the equation ds²/dt² - µi(1 - s²i) dsi/dt + si = 0. The input series are generated from these equations, while the label series is a linear combination of the shifted input series.
dcterms:title: Two Non-linear Damping Signals
